laboratory_examinations.findings: Protein excretion in the urine was 5382 mg/24 h (normal, 30-100 mg/24 h).

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Serum Creatinine and Blood Urea Nitrogen Test
laboratory_examinations.findings: Serum creatinine and blood urea nitrogen were within reference range.
a-Galactosidase A activity in extracts of the patientâ€™s cultured peripheral white blood cells was less than 1% of the mean of 3 normal control specimens.
Histological examination revealed scattered foamy macrophages in portal areas.
Before infusion, the amount of globotriaosylceramide (Gb3) in the liver sample obtained was 25 nmol/mg of protein. After infusion, the value was 16 nmol/mg of protein (36% reduction).
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Significant reduction in Gb3 levels in the liver after infusion.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Globotriaosylceramide in the 24-hour pre-infusion sample was 1958 nmol/g of creatinine.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Gb3 in the 28-day post-infusion sample was 640 nmol/g of creatinine (67% reduction); no reduction of Gb3 was seen in the 24-hour or 7-day post-infusion specimens.
